fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63463].
  {panel}

h3. Description

Label position is wrong in various forms, whenever html {{<fieldset>}} is used.

Example create issue page:

!image-2016-12-07-10-45-22-578.png!
h3. Workaround

This is a Chrome bug: [https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=670837] 

Do not upgrade to Chrome 55.0.2883.75 

This bug [is fixed|https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/1707000b18468db81dc63536da511d1b2964ce8d] in Chrome 55  - it means that  the next Chrome update (55.0.2883.87) will have it 
h3. Affected versions

All versions since at least 6.0 (AUI upgrade)
fields.summary: Wrong position of labels in forms

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63462].
  {panel}

Hi,

I managed to get JIRA running via Apache's virtual host (using the proxy module). This makes that the web address doesn't contain the port number, and I can use SSL.

It all works fine, except for the message that I receive when logging out (see screenshot). Is there maybe another way to configure JIRA the way I want it?

Another question is: how can I force a redirect from the URL with the port number to my new URL? I cannot make Apache listen on that port.

Regards,

Edwin
fields.summary: Incorrect base URL message showing up
Plugin Usage report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63457].
  {panel}

h2. Definition 

When a reporter moves an issue to a destination project where he doesn't have access to, the issue will just be gone and won't be accessible to the reporter anymore.
h2. Suggestion

This can be avoided if there's a validator that will check whether the reporter has an access to the project where he is moving the issue to.
fields.summary: Reporter Validation When Moving an Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63441].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Road Map plugin there are only 3 actions that can be performed:

* Click the name of a project to browse the project.
* Click the name of a version to browse the version.
* Click the progress bar (shown in red and/or green) to view the version's issues in the Issue Navigator.

User would like feature to filter Release/ Versions and also output date fields per the available date fields for Release/Versions.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add ability to filter release/version and output due fields directly in the gadget.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Add function in Road map gadget to filter versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63438].
  {panel}

h1. Problem

The 'Save' button in the form to enter a comment has a keyboard shortcut for submitting the form, which on Mac+Chrome is *Ctrl+Alt+s*. With the new Visual mode editor for comments, the keyboard shortcut does nothing.

Note: I have not tested this against other OS/browser combinations.
h1. Steps to reproduce
 # Create/view an issue, press the Comment button
 # Enter a comment and use the keyboard shortcut to submit the form

h2. Expected

Form submits
h2. Actual

Nothing happens
h1. Work around

Any of these should work:
 * Switch to Text mode in the form
 * Manually submit the form with the mouse
 * Ctrl/Command + Enter
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut for submitting a comment does not work when the text input is in Visual Mode
Clickable JQL Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63434].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Some users track the number of times an issue has been re-opened. Currently there are no built-in workflow post-functions to increase the value of a field after a workflow transition has been made. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Incorporate the "Increase value of field" (from JMWE) as a post-function in JIRA functionality. 

You could also create a new incremental or arithmetic based field type. 

h3. Workaround 
Subscribe to JIRA Miscellaneous Workflow Extension add-on.
fields.summary: Add "Increase value of field" post-function to JIRA Core/Software workflows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63427].
  {panel}

The attached screenshot shows the "Create" transition of any issue in JIRA workflows. Unfortunately there are two ways to reach that same transition from the JIRA UI:
1. An issue is being created using the "Create" button
2. An issue is being created using the More->Clone menu item of another issue

In my workflow, these two cases require significantly different handling. Specifically, my users like to use (2) instead of (1)

And in fact often they even prefer to clone an issue in the wrong project then move it to the right project instead of just using the "Create" button in the right project.

 

This known behavior was ok before one of our web hook integrations was built for two way sync of bugs, but it became catastrophic afterward. The classic error was to clone an issue to create a completely unrelated issue in a project that is not even tracked by this process. The result was a bunch of dangling bugs in the other application created "by mistake" because someone decided to "clone+move" instead of "create".

So I need two separate transitions, one for create and a different one for clone, in order to track the different set of actions that I need to take in one case or the other. Right now that can be done with undocumented code in Scriptrunner (so undocumented that I've never even got a straight answer from Jamie Echlin: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/9863448/answers/38752668] ). Here's the code I'm using:

if(issue.key == null)

\{ // If the issue is not a clone, we honor whatever issuetype that // was set at issue creation screen return }

else

\{ // The issue is a clone. A few fields need to be purged here, because // purging them in normal post-functions would clear them even if they // had been explicitly set during the create screen of a new bug.  }

While this looks pretty simple, being completely undocumented means that every time the support team upgrades JIRA or the scriptrunner plugin, this might break.

The other, more annoying side effect is that once this logic is in play, any custom field that needs to be managed during this transition will need to be inside this same script, and I lose all the advantages of the JIRA UI managing post functions.

Specifically, in my bug workflow, when an issue is being cloned (but not when an issue is being created anew) I need to:
 - Change the issuetype to "Bug" for clones to avoid unnecessary triggers
 - Purge 4 custom fields

These custom fields cannot be purged on a "Create new" (as opposed to "Create clone") because they are present in the editor when an issue is created, and the user could decide to explicitly set them to something at creation time (same deal of the Issuetype "bug (public)").
fields.summary: Separate "Create new" and "Create as clone" transitions in workflows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63416].
  {panel}

We have users who paste the URL of a ticket into another JIRA issue Issue link dialog. When they go to save, it says that it cannot find the ticket number.

It would be helpful if when a URL is added to this field, it identifies the ticket number and strips out the URL part. Of course this should only apply to the current and other linked JIRA instances (eg. JIRA to JIRA issue linking).

Example of the situation:

!image-2016-12-02-11-38-40-017.png|width=513,height=299!
fields.summary: Identify ticket number when linking JIRA Issue by Issue URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no possibility to have a description under the Column name on the board
*  !Board columns name and description.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer would want to add description under the Column name on the board

h3. Why this is important
Customer's quote:
{quote}
The number of words in the policy would make it unmanageable to display in the column header. That's why we think that a more sensible place would be to have it in the hover-over text for the column header.
{quote}
 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround available
fields.summary: Ability to add description under the columns name on the board
Enhance Issue Link Type Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63412].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA protects access to its administrative functions by requiring a secure administration session in order to use the JIRA administration screens, which is known as websudo.) When a JIRA administrator (who is logged into JIRA) attempts to access an administration function, they are prompted to log in again. 

However, not every administrative function is protected by websudo, for example, the *Audit Log*.

h3. Suggested Solution
Enable websudo for every administrative function
fields.summary: Enable websudo for every administrative function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63411].
  {panel}

Summary

Pie Chart Gadget does not allow any data-interpretation configuration.

It would be good if one could customise the gadget's outcome; for instance - by specifying which subset of attributes (i.e.: labels) should be calculated and presented on Pie Chart.
h5. Steps to reproduce:
 # Add labels for multiple issues. For example, Issue A was labelled *TESTA*, *TESTB*, *TESTC*, *TESTD*, *TESTE* and Issue B was labelled *TESTA*, *TESTB*, *TESTC*.
 # Go to issue navigator and save the filter with *labels in (TESTA, TESTB, TESTC)*
 # Go to dashboard and create Pie Chart with the saved filter.
 # Pie Chart will display labels *TESTA*, *TESTB*, *TESTC*, *TESTD*, *TESTE*.
 !Capture 2016-12-03 at 10.46.45.png|thumbnail!
 # This happens because Issue A is labelled *TESTD*, *TESTE*.

h5. Environment

JIRA 6.4.14, JIRA 7.2.5
h5. Expected Results

JIRA only display labels specified in the gadget's configuration
h5. Notes

Limiting the presented data to a custom-specified subset bares a high risk of data mis-interpretation. Rendered charts SHOULD in a discrete but clearly visible way NOTIFY the end user that presented data is limited to a pre-defined SUBSET. 
h3.
fields.summary: Pie Chart Gadget should allow limiting the scope of displayed data
Ability to view System Info page in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63406].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
In JIRA Service Desk, there's an Automation rule for WHEN *A linked issue is transitioned*. This rule however only applies to linked issues within the same instance. It doesn't work for linked issues from a different instance.

h4. Suggestion
Add the ability to automate an issue when a linked issue from a linked instance is transitioned.

h4. Note
The 2 instances are linked together using Applinks.
fields.summary: Ability to automate an issue when a linked issue from a linked instance is transitioned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63400].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It would be helpful with JQL to be able to search for issues by comparing user fields to other user fields (e.g. where Assignee == Reporter   or where Reporter == Requested Participants (on service desk))


h3. Suggested Solution
Currently this is not possible to do with JQL, as you cannot compare user fields against other user fields.   All user field can be compared with is a text value.  As for functions, only {{CurrentUser()}} and {{memberOf()}} functions can be used for this, neither of which can make these kinds of comparisons.


h3. Why this is important
This can be very useful from a JIRA admin point of view in order to be able to find issues that meet certain user criteria.  For example, when the assignee is also the reporter, or when one of the user fields matches a user in a custom user field.   This kind of comparison should be relatively easy to implement within JQL and in turn could extend the functionality significantly.

 
h3. Workaround 
This is something that can be done with [Scriptrunner|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview].  Only then can you gain access to other JQL functions such as {code:borderStyle=solid}
issuefunction in expression("project = FOO", "assignee != reporter") 
{code}


Examples of users on [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/] looking for this functionality:
* [Help with JQL assignee != reporter - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/4981880/help-with-jql-assignee-reporter]
* [JQL Scripted Function to check if assignee = reporter? - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/200713/jql-scripted-function-to-check-if-assignee-reporter]
* [Is it possible to search for issues where assignee=reporter? - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/318999/is-it-possible-to-search-for-issues-where-assignee-reporter]
* [Assignee not same as reporter - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/250557/assignee-not-same-as-reporter]
* [JQL Query for searching issues that are assigned to the reporter - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/91037/jql-query-for-searching-issues-that-are-assigned-to-the-reporter]
* [JQL: query issues where assignee != project lead; or where assignee != reporter - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/64387/jql-query-issues-where-assignee-project-lead-or-where-assignee-reporter]
fields.summary: Add JQL function to allow the comparison of user fields to each other
Update License Compatibility Matrix to cover Cross Product Compatibility
Jira should support GIF based avatars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63396].
  {panel}

If an issue that has story points is closed without being assigned to a sprint, those story points will never appear in any burndown chart.

It would be very nice if the user was presented with a confirmation dialog when trying to close an issue that has story points but that has not been assigned to a sprint.

This could either be a basic "This issue has story points but has not been assigned to a sprint. Proceed? OK/Cancel" dialog, or a more complex "... Assign this issue to the current sprint before closing? Yes/No" dialog that would assign the issue to the current sprint before closing it if the user chooses "yes".

People make mistakes. This would help them avoid doing so, and train them to assign the issue to the current sprint before attempting to close it.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Closing an issue that is not assigned to a sprint should pop a confirmation dialog

h3. Problem Definition
Several methods in {{ChangeHistoryManager}} interface returns a list of changes. However, no sort order is documented. If user wants to sort, they'll have to do so manually

h3. Suggested Solution
Define a sort for methods in {{ChangeHistoryManager}}

h3. Why this is important
This would greatly help and reduce time/work in plugin development

h3. Workaround 
Retrive the list using the method and then manually sort the results
fields.summary: Define sort for methods in ChangeHistoryManager
Calendar widget should show days from prev&next month (greyed but slectable)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63388].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When exporting issues that contain inward issue link, there is no column for Inward issue link in the export .csv file.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud v1000.606.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue A and B
# Link issue A to B (e.g _relates to_ link)
# Search for issue A and B in issue navigator
# Export these issues by using _Export Excel CSV_ via the export feature

h3. Expected Results
The CSV file should have both _Inward issue link_ and Outward issue link_

h3. Actual Results
The CSV file contains only _Outward issue link_
 
h3. Notes
In https://<instance_name>/secure/admin/ViewLinkTypes!default.jspa, both Inward and Outward Description for *Relates* link are using *relates to* 

h3.Workaround
Alternatively, you can use [Jira Cloud for Sheets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220382/jira-cloud-for-google-sheets-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] as it exports the "Linked Issues" field the way it appears on the JQL Filter.
fields.summary: Export Excel CSV does not export the Inward issue link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63384].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 14 January 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how your teams work and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

We have decided to close this specific request for _additional status categories_ as Won't Fix. The finite set of status categories allows us to build useful features on top of them, like completion progress indicators for Epics and Versions.

We recognize that for many teams, most of the steps in a workflow are "In Progress" and that it can be difficult to distinguish them. Here are some strategies:
* Add additional columns to your board for different workflow states. You can have several "In Progress" columns to represent concepts like "In Development" or "Under Review".
* Use the card colors based on JQL queries feature ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-colours]) to define your own colors for workflow states. I've created this suggestion in the JIRA Agile project to improve this in the future: GHS-11666
* Use JIRA Agile card layouts (new in JIRA Agile 6.6) to show the workflow state on the card ([documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Customising+Cards#CustomisingCards-fields])
* To customize the display of issues within the JIRA issue navigator, consider the free third-party [icnavigator add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.iconcept.icnavigator.jira-icnavigator] from Interconcept GmbH.

We do not plan to support arbitrary colors for status categories. The mapping of blue, yellow, and green to "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done" is part of [Atlassian's overall visual system|https://design.atlassian.com/latest/product/components/lozenges/]. Our intent is to improve how we use this pattern to communicate information in JIRA; however, we use the combination of colors and lozenges to represent concepts not only in JIRA, but across Atlassian's product suite.

Finally, there were specific requests for a "Red" status color. The main use case here was situations where an issue had progressed to the end of a workflow, but the resolution was negative (e.g. "Failed" instead of "Done"). In JIRA's structure, this connects the final workflow state (i.e. "Resolved") with the type of resolution. While there's certainly merit in this request, it has the potential to significantly increase JIRA's complexity.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

The new status colors in JIRA provides initial set of pre-defined statues. It would also be beneficial to add the ability for users to add more categories to it
fields.summary: Ability to add more categories to statuses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63382].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Add On Users Should be Removed When instance is Exported From Cloud to Server
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a cloud instance that has a plugin installed that creates the atlassian-addons-project-access role
 # Import to Server instance

h3. Expected Results

The atlassian-addons-project-access role should be removed during the downgrade to Server
h3. Actual Results

The role still exists
h3. Workaround
 - Navigate to *Administration > System > Project Role Browser*
 - Click *Delete* next to the *atlassian-addons-project-access* role to remove it.
fields.summary: Add On Users Should be Removed When Instance is Exported From Cloud and imported to Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63381].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating a JIRA backup using Internet Explorer never presents the link with the create file to be downloaded, it's just stuck at the "_Exporting data_" message or "_Please wait_" message if the page is refreshed.
h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud version 1000.586.0
Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using Internet Explorer 11 go to JIRA administration > System > Backup manager
# Click the Create backup for Cloud or Server buttons

h3. Expected Results
After the contents are exported a link should be presented to download the backup file.

h3. Actual Results
The page is stuck with the "_Exporting files_" message and if the page is refreshed the message changes to "_Please wait_" but the link to download the files never appears

h3.Workaround
Using another modern browser like Firefox, Chrome or Edge, access the Backup Manager page and you should see the link to download the file there.
fields.summary: Creating a JIRA backup using Internet Explorer never presents the link to download the file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63380].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
 * At the moment, some fields for certain gadgets gets displayed in an order that is not alphabetical. For example for the *Two Dimensional Gadget* the *XAxis* field is not displayed alphabetically. The screenshot below shows this order:[^TwoDimen72.png]
 * !TwoDimen72.png|thumbnail!

*Suggested Solution*
 * It would be great to have the field values for the fields of gadgets to be displayed in an alphabetical order. This would make it more convenient to search for field values in a long list.
fields.summary: Field values of gadget fields being displayed alphabetically.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63379].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
According to the [User management REST API changes in JIRA Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/User+management+REST+API+changes+in+JIRA+Cloud] documentation the "_Change user password_" endpoint was removed because these APIs create, modify or delete user attributes and passwords, which are no longer managed by the JIRA tenant with the rollout of Atlassian account and SSO. 
h3. Suggested Solution
At the end of that documentation it says that "_Atlassian accounts cannot be managed via public APIs today. We are currently evaluating how best to expose these capabilities in a secure manner that best meets our customers' use cases._"
This request is to track the re-implementation of such endpoint.
h3. Why this is important
This removal breaks some functionalities of some services like Okta.
fields.summary: Bring back the "Change user password" REST API endpoint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63377].
  {panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*June 08, 2017 update:* migration to new version of [Tempo for cloud|https://support.tempo.io/hc/en-us/articles/228918728-New-Version-of-Tempo-Timesheets-and-Tempo-Planner-for-JIRA-Cloud] is planned to be finished for all customers by end of June, 2017. 
{panel}

h3. Summary
Workflow in issue won't load.
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to replicate
# Go to any existing issues
# Click on *View Workflow*

h3. Expectation
The project's workflow is displayed

h3. Actual Result
Spinning wheels loading endlessly

We can see this error in the browser's console:{noformat}Uncaught TypeError: this.html.droppable is not a function(…)init {noformat}

h3. Cause
Recent changes in JIRA are causing the Tempo Core add-on (bundled in JIRA system add-ons) to manifest this error when Tempo Timesheets is disabled.


h3. Workaround
Contact Cloud support at support.atlassian.com to enable Tempo Timesheets add-on
Note: The add-on will still be unlicensed so you won't be charged for it.
fields.summary: Workflow view within issue does not load
Can't use long decimals in timetracking fields
Default Environment Checkbox for Issue Collector to Checked

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63368].
  {panel}

When a project administrator (not JIRA administrator) changes a project avatar it resets the project category. The project category field is read-only, so there is no workaround by f.e. setting the project category manually.

 

Steps to reproduce:
 * Login as a project administrator (role administrator for a project)
 * Go to project
 * Click project settings
 * Click details
 * Select different avatar
 * Save

 

Expected result:
 * Project category is still the same

 

Actual result:
 * Project category is "none"

 

JIRA version is 7.2.5
fields.summary: Reset of project category when project admin changes avatar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63367].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Cloud to Server Import Fails due to unknown Entities
h3. Environment
 * Cloud backup created from {{JIRA Build 1000.571.2#100021-sha1:be9d69a21ddd1ef41d0d1a95feb6b77a6714b7e4}}
 * JIRA Server 7.2.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate backup from cloud instance
 # Restore to JIRA Server 7.2.1

h3. Expected Results

The import will complete successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file and the import fails:
{noformat}2016-11-29 16:25:52,443 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR anonymous 971x59x1 1ddmzvy 172.20.44.29 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericDelegator.makeValue] could not find entity for entityName: UpgradeTaskHistory
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericDelegator.makeValue] could not find entity for entityName: UpgradeTaskHistory
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.makeValue(GenericDelegator.java:491)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.makeValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:315)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.makeValue(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:182)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler.parseValue(OfbizImportHandler.java:287)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler.startElement(OfbizImportHandler.java:204)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.security.xml.RestrictedXMLReader.parse(RestrictedXMLReader.java:103)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreData(DefaultDataImportService.java:891)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:719)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
Prior to the failure the following error is also observed:
{code:java}2016-11-29 16:12:43,621 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO anonymous 971x59x1 1ddmzvy 172.20.44.29 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler] Failed to parse value for element UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericDelegator.makeValue] could not find entity for entityName: UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.makeValue(GenericDelegator.java:491)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.makeValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:315)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.makeValue(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:182)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler.parseValue(OfbizImportHandler.java:287)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler.parseValueFailsafe(OfbizImportHandler.java:271)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler.startElement(OfbizImportHandler.java:207)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.security.xml.RestrictedXMLReader.parse(RestrictedXMLReader.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.parseXmlAndValidateBackupData(DefaultDataImportService.java:367)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:290)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}
h3. Workaround
 - Unzip the backup
 - Run the following command to remove these entries
 -- {{egrep -v "(UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog|UpgradeTaskHistory)" entities.xml > entities-purged.xml}}
 - Run the command to rezip the backup:
 -- {{mv entities-purged.xml entities.xml ; zip -r MyBackupFile.zip entities.xml activeobjects.xml}}
 - Restore should now complete successfully
fields.summary: Cloud to Server Import Fails due to unknown Entities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63365].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Linking between epics and story (or epic and initiave) requires Edit issue permission for both issue, since it's updating issue fields. This limits the admin's ability to restrict this permission (to be able to link epics) to specific user.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have a separate permission for this action.
fields.summary: Separate permission for Epic link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63363].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The following error appears in the logs (atlassian-jira.log) when performing random tasks:
{code}
2016-11-24 19:42:00,207 http-nio-8065-exec-21 ERROR anonymous 1181x1219x1 ubd1wo 10.60.10.50 /browse/AAS [c.a.j.w.f.steps.requestcleanup.WebworkActionCleanupStep] Thread corrupted! ActionContext still references a HttpRequest. URL: 'http://syd-ordinarypeople.office.atlassian.com:8065/GHS-59692/browse/AAS'. Attempted to clean up: true
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a certain project. 
# Then View all projects in a new tab.
# And choose another project. 
_(not limited to the above steps. Could happen with random actions or navigations)_


h3. Expected Results
No Errors in the logs

h3. Actual result
The above *Thread Corrupted* error is thrown in the logs with no effects in the UI.
fields.summary: Thread Corrupted error appears in the logs with no effects in the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63362].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

It's possible to show the Subtasks column in Issue Navigator to show list of Subtasks belong to an issue. However, there is no _Parent Column_ to show the other way around.

h3. Suggested Resolution
 
Provide "Parent task column" in Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Provide "Parent task column" in Issue Navigator
JIRA 7.1.4 Open attachment in new Tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63359].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
There is a bug on the integration between IDEs like Webstorm and JIRA, although the support for IDE in JIRA was discontinued.

The bug was reported originally in our JIRA support site to be fixed since when using this integration our users were being logged out of JIRA.You can see the bug reported here:
[JRA-42154|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42154]

Since this issue was related to a connector, the bug was moved to the Connector's project:
[PL-3051|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/PL-3051]

https://developer.atlassian.com/blog/2015/06/discontinuing-ide-connectors-support/

h3. Suggestion

Add any kind of compatibility or feature where the user does not face the login intermittent issue when making API calls to JIRA.

h3. Workarounds

*I was able to find some workarounds on my research that might be useful, although it's necessary an additional license in JIRA, which is inconvenient for our customers*

- Change the password of your own account, so if an unknown app / service was using your account and destroying the sessions it no longer could
- Create a dedicated account and use it credentials to connect Webstorm and Jira. In this way, Webstorm could no longer destroy the sessions of your own account.
- You can upgrade to snapshot versions in the Global Settings -> General -> Auto Upgrade section of the connector's configuration. (This workaround was suggested PL-3051 comments).
fields.summary: Compatibility between JIRA and Webstorm IDE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63357].
  {panel}

So I mostly create project and add those clients to their relevant projects. But for security purpose I always want to make sure by logging in as User. 
But the issue is that my clients always get email notifications that admin logged in as user to their account.

 

This message is totally irrelevant to them and disturbs them and they mostly complain me about that.

So I really appreciate if you add any feature that can help admin to disable such kind of notification so that admin can set up things silently.

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Admin should have option to disable notification while logging in as User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63356].
  {panel}

It would be great if we could write custom queries that utilize other custom queries.

It would allow us to write modular queries.

Example:

JQL1: (status not in (Resolved, Closed) AND originalEstimate is EMPTY OR status in (Open, Reopened, "In Progress") AND remainingEstimate = 0) AND type != Epic

JQL2: Project = DEV and +JQL1+

JQL3: Project = APP and +JQL1+

...

JQLn: Project = n and +JQL1+

 

Such capability will allow us to make changes to JQL1 without the need of updating JQL2 - JQLn

This is invaluable specially if such custom filters are used in dashboards.

 

Thanks for considering it.
fields.summary: JQL Filter (query) using custom filter (query)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63355].
  {panel}

h3. *Problem:*

There is a need to use issue key numbers for quick search preview results. when a user tries to use only alphanumeric characters there's no result and a frowny face appears (Please, check the screen attached).

Quick search box could be more friendly and bring close results as suggestions in the preview.

h3. *Example:* When inputting in the quick search box any issue key number for instance 1234, if project key eg: EN-1234 is not specified, the preview doesn't return any suggestions, and it doesn't return close searches either.

h3. *Suggestion:* 

Add approximated results to the quick search suggestion preview or have a wildcard function so the user can use issue key numbers to search.
fields.summary: Quick search preview using issue key numbers
As a JIRA admin, I need a way to know that the "Current Status" field on JAC was updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63353].
  {panel}

I would have listed this as a bug...

When you select some text in the WYSIWYG text editor and click on External Link, or press Ctrl+K to enter new link, brackets are added arround with an [http://example.com|http://example.com/] URL, but the text you selected remains selected. It would be much, much more comfortable if the example URL gets highlighted instead. This way, if you copied a link from somewhere else, you can just paste it with Ctrl+V directly over the example domain after doing a Ctrl+K.

GitHub does this.

Thank you!
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor, when having text selected and clicking External Link the example link should be selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63352].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in the JIRA Issue Navigator, the only comment related search criteria is "Comment" which allows you to search text of a comment. 

It would be beneficial to see a criteria that displays issues by their last commented date. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Add a "Last commented" filter in Issue Navigator. 
h3. Workaround 
For server, there is an add-on (CCC Last Commented) that can be installed to do this. However, the add-on is only available in Cloud. There is currently no workaround in JIRA Cloud.
fields.summary: Add a "Last Commented" search criteria in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63351].
  {panel}

*Request of the Background*

User should have the option to customise incoming emails per project


*Example*
1 There is an JIRA Software project called "ProjectX"
2 Customer sents an e-mail to projectx@poort80.atlassian.net .
3 Ticket is created in ProjectX or - if already created- added as an comment.

1 There is an JIRA Software project called "ProjectY"
2 Customer sents an e-mail to projecty@poort80.atlassian.net .
3 Ticket is created in ProjectY or - if already created - added as an comment.
fields.summary: Be able to customise incoming emails per project
Manifest imporovements for Generic Application Links
Support for golang syntax highlighting in the code snippet
Add YAML and JSON code formatters to Jira text editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63347].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Code Block Macro does not currently include Swift highlighting.

h3. Suggested Solution
To help iOS developing customers, include Swift highlighting as an option
fields.summary: Include Swift Highlighting in Code Block Macro
Add line number support to the {code} tag in Mark-up.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63345].
  {panel}

Often jira-users have multiple roles.

A dev team might be a customer of the IT Support team for example. The IT support team likes to use JIRA ServiceDesk for all its tricks and features, but since the dev team are experienced jira-users they want to use the create button for these types of tickets as well. 

The IT Support team would still like to suggest KB articles for all users - regardless if they use the create button inside JIRA our on the portal. 

Can KB articles be hooked up to JIRA issue create screen perhaps?
fields.summary: Display KB article match on JIRA Issue Creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63344].
  {panel}

We just upgraded from 6.4.11 to 7.2.5 and when using the time tracking theres a new link at the bottom of the page saying *"Find more time-tracking add-ons"*.

I disabled the feature* "Allow users to request add-ons"* and I somehow hoped that this would hide this link but didn't.

 

*Suggestions:*

1.) *remove* the link "Find more time-tracking add-ons"

2.) *connect the visibility* of "Find more time-tracking add-ons" with that flag "Allow users to request add-ons"

IMHO this link is an ad to buy more stuff and should be optional.
fields.summary: Hide or remove "Find more time-tracking add-ons"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63343].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Documentation for 6.4 to current is incorrect for details on configuring Services, and Feature is not detailed in release notes:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/jira-6-4-release-notes-720414168.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Services
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Services
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Services
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Services

Currently Details the process under the section *Registering a service* the option:
{quote}
Delay — the delay (in minutes) between service runs.
For example, to add a debugging service, click the Built-in Services link followed by the Debugging Service link.
{quote}

The Delay Option was fully removed and replaced with Schedule and interval functionality and no longer includes any option on the delay in minutes, all current options are scheduled as a cron type job.

Schedule options:
* Daily
* Days per Week
* Days per Month
* Advanced << Full cron job syntax

With Specific Interval configurations per Schedule Option

h3. Suggested Solution
- Add details for the feature to the release notes
- Update Documentation with details on the feature for Documentation versions 6.4 to current
 
h3.JIRA 6.3.15 and below:
!Screen Shot 2016-11-28 at 2.05.52 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.JIRA 6.4 and Above:
!Screen Shot 2016-11-28 at 3.38.59 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Documentation Error missing details on Update to Services Feature
Preview Microsoft Office Files in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63336].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
After the user create a ticket, the pop-ups with the ticket number shows up for a small amount of time. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the possibility of controlling how long the pop-up appears for the user.
fields.summary: Ability to control how long the creation ticket pop-up appears
New

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63334].
  {panel}

Hi there,

it would be nice if all status options, that are not relevant for a user are not shown in the basic search.

At the moment, the user will see all status that are used in the system.

in our case, many of the user don't need that, neither they like it. i.e. a person has the rights for only one project where a workflow is used that has maybe 5 out of 30 available status. If he wants to create a filter with basic search, he will find all the 30 status in the system, though he only will see a query when he uses the 5 he has permission for.

Would it be possible to fade out all the other status?

 

Best Regards,

Alex Richter
fields.summary: Hide status from User
Update the IIS Guide, sidebar icon missing in IE
Epic Link Issue key is grayed out too much (not visible) when adding epic link to issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63324].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Right now,  with JIRA Cloud, when you create a custom field of Date type, it is showing as wrapped even when native JIRA dates field are not even when screen is downsized.  See reference print

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if Date type fields do not show as wrapped
fields.summary: Custom field of Date type shouldn't be wrapped

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63323].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

As u user, there are some requirements that I need to have:
# Make Assignee as required globally by setting  Allow unassigned issues to Off
# Hide this field from Issue Collector
# In the project, the default assignee is already assigned to a user.
# JIRA should still allow user to create a new Issue Collector

Current behavior, JIRA doesn't allow it.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Allow Assignee to be set as required without being shown in Issue Collector.
fields.summary: Allow Assignee to be set as required without being shown in Issue Collector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63321].
  {panel}

h2. Problem

When a saved filter is used in a JIRA or Confluence gadget, the ORDER BY clause in the JQL is not considered when the expectation is that it will.

 
h2. Suggestion

Ensure that Atlassian's in-house JIRA and Confluence gadgets respect this rule.
fields.summary: The ORDER BY clause in saved filters should be respected when used in a Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63318].
  {panel}

# Open a new browser tab
 # Go to google.com
 # Copy paster this link to go to jdog issue: [https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/VI-2022?src=foobar]
 # Wait until page is fully loaded
 # Press back button in browser
 # :(

Presumably something in the JIRA front end messes up browser history by adding the current url there, causing issues with browser's back button functionality. This seems to only happen when there's ?src parameter in the url.
fields.summary: Having ?src parameter in url messes up browser history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63317].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA has many System Filters which are shown per project and easily switched between from the sidebar of a project.  As an administrator, I would like specific filters to be shown on a per project basis.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow administrators the ability to control which filters are included for each project, including adding my own custom filters shared with this project and to be switchable from the switch filter drop-down menu.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like to customize and add to the System Filters available for each project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63314].
  {panel}

h4. Problem

Customer couldn't get shared home directory files created even though the permissions has been granted to the directory.
h4. Suggestion

Resolved by using [Configuring the JIRA HOME over an UNC path|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Configuring+the+JIRA+HOME+over+an+UNC+path] KB and suggest to include the KB into [JIRA Data Center installation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-jira-data-center-802592197.html] documentation so other users able to find the workaround without reported to support at the first place.
fields.summary: Update Installing JIRA Data Center documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63313].
  {panel}

Multi line custom fields with a rather large amount of text are being collapsed on the view screen. _(JIRA v7.2.3)_
This behavior differs from JIRA 6.4.x where it collapses for any amount of text.

On both versions all text is displayed on a single line which can be confusing.
In the example I have a bullet list where every bullet is on the same line once collapsed

It would be better not to display the other lines and replace them with 3 dots for example {{...}}
Same happens to tables which is totally impractical

!image-2016-11-24-12-27-20-770.png!

!image-2016-11-24-12-27-36-377.png!

slightly related to JRA-60867
fields.summary: Collapsed multi line custom fields should hide other lines
Allow users to select more colors in the text color selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63309].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA [Core Boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-boards-800712866.html] are now available in the Cloud envionrmnt.  It would be nice to be able to configure the Cards to show additional information like you can in a [JIRA Software|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/customizing-cards-764478020.html#Customizingcards-fieldsAddingfieldstocards]. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option to Customize the Core Boards and the Cards used
 
h3. Workaround 
Enable JIRA Software
fields.summary: Allow Card Customization With JIRA Core Boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63306].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Clicking on the profile menu items (My JIRA Home) requires two clicks instead of one
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the Profile icon menu on the top-right of JIRA
 # Click ‘Boards’ (and Boards will now be set correctly to the location you go to if you only type the site URL for JIRA) !My JIRA Home menu.png|thumbnail!
 # Click the profile icon again
 # Select ‘Issue Navigator’ or ‘Dashboards’

h3. Expected Results

The Issue Navigator or the Dashboard to be set as the new My JIRA home (and they will now be set correctly to the location you go to if you only type the site URL for JIRA)
h3. Actual Results

The dot on the menu switches to the correct item, this setting is not saved server side.
h3. Workaround

Click the item twice instead of once.
fields.summary: Some My JIRA Home menu items require 2 clicks to be set correctly
